title.rendered: October 2014 Fall Carnival Specials and Sales

content.rendered:
We’re beyond excited for Second Sunday on Main this Sunday, October 12. Â In addition to a pumpkin market, live music, and our regular vendor market, Main Street’s shops will be offering fall treats, specials, and sales. Even some of our vendors will be offering fall specials! Check ’em out!

More detailsÂ on Second Sunday on Main’s Fall Carnival event

Main Street Shop Specials

Streetpops -Â Streetpops‘ last day till next summer. Lots of great fall flavors like kettle corn, salted caramel, and orange spiced honey.

Higher Branches – fall-themed crafts for kids

The Drinkery – Kyle Knapp (The Turkeys, Â Skywriters, & Future Strikes) playing from 3-5 and we’ll be open 1-6 for Second Sunday.

You Do Yoga – Acro Yoga 1-3pm

Hoop & Needle – Celebrate the last SSOM of the season with 20% off store-wide

LIBBY – 30% off sale on select jewelry and clothing, tarot card readings by Patricia Garry

Richard Butz Gallery – Current exhibit: “Oil Paintings by Cody Gunningham” up through October 26.Â  Artist talk by Cody will be at the Gallery on Second Sunday to talk about his paintings. Also paintings by Dan Becker, James Sivitz, and Richard Butz; sculpture by Kyle Penunuri; pottery by Alex Reed; and miscellaneous home accessories.

A Seamless Transition will be passing out candy as well as offering a store wide 20% discount to all who are dressed carnival/Halloween/spirited (including anyone who comes In with a kiddo in costume as well)

Rock Paper Scissors – ‘fall is the season for crafting’ Sale- all cold-weather-crafty things like wool, yarns, and kids’ art and craft supplies

Park + VineÂ 

Second Sunday on Main Hopwater Tasting – Join the Hopwater team 1 to 4 p.m. and be among the first to sample all four Hopwater flavors: Lime, Ginger, Grapefruit, and original Hop Tonic. Let Brandon Dawson and Tony Moore know what you think, sign up for their mailing list, and get hopped up for their official launch in early 2015.

Finding Your Homeâ€™s Ancestors Book Signing Meet author Ann Senefeld of Digging Cincinnati History for a book signing of Finding Your Homeâ€™s Ancestors 2-5 p.m. Are you curious about the history of your home? Would you like to find out who lived there before you and what they did? Learn what resources are available to find your homeâ€™s ancestors and create its very own family tree.

League for Animal Welfare Mobile Adoption Van, 12-4:Â League for Animal Welfare mobile adoption van is making a stop in front of Park + Vine during Second Sunday on Main noon to 4 p.m. Oct. 12. As a privately funded, non-profit no-kill animal organization, League for Animal Welfareâ€™s mission is to better the lives of cats and dogs in Greater Cincinnati. Their activities focus on sheltering homeless cats and dogs with a goal of finding forever homes for them all. League provides spay/neuter vouchers, kitten/puppy bottle-feeding programs, foster care, and cat/dog enrichment programs too.

Vendor Specials

Boba Cha – BoBa Cha will bring bubble tea, bubble MilkTea or bubble soy MilkTea from their Main Street shop. 2 bubble tea for $5!

Stitches and Wicks will offer candles in a variety of fall scents, including pumpkin pie, pumpkin soufflÃ©, pomegranate cider, apple harvest, and spice market to name a few! They willÂ also will have a varietyÂ of new scarves,Â cowls, and ear warmers just in time for the fall season. Mention the promo code: Boo to receive 10% off any purchase!Â 

Brown Bear BakeryÂ – All sorts of fall treatsÂ at the Brown Bear Bakery booth. Caramel Apples, Pumpkin, Chai Spice, andÂ Starry Night Macarons, and Black Cat Cookies to name a few.Â 

Hot HennaÂ will haveÂ henna-ed pumpkinsÂ 

Out of the Drawer QuiltsÂ isÂ celebrating Breast Cancer Awareness Month by offering 20% off any pink ribbon bag purchased.

Bundle Up CrochetÂ -Â In honor of Breast Cancer Awareness Month, Bundle Up Crochet will be selling a special pink winter crocheted headband (with optional add-on flower) and donating half of the proceeds for each sale to the Pink Ribbon Girls.

A “Mother’s Touch” CakesÂ is offeringÂ “Fall Mini Samplers,” a delicious assortment of Fall Gourmet cupcakes for only $10 (save $4) featuring Caramel Apple, Perfectly Pumpkin, Zipporah Chai Tea, Vanilla bean and Chocolate Ganache!
